description.first: Full Stack Developer, optimistic, transparent and with a lot of energy to contribute. I am currently working as a Front End developer at House of CB, where I help with the development of the brand's ecommerce.
description.second: I find in software development the opportunity to create products that optimize processes and improve the user experience.
description.third: A brief summary of my work so far.

firstParagraph.text: is a leading British womenswear brand, internationally acclaimed for its designer pieces. With more than 40 stores around the world and a strong presence on social networks.

secondParagraph.text: In 2024, currently as a frontend developer, I worked on the
secondParagraph.otherText: migration to Next.js 14. This involved optimizing processes, documenting, and reorganizing the entire project structure. In addition, I set up Google Analytics for site traffic analysis and implemented multi-language, currency, and cache functionalities.

firstParagraph.text: is a company dedicated to manufacturing and selling furniture. They wanted to build a portfolio showcasing their completed projects to enhance the credibility of the brand.

secondParagraph.otherText: using Next.js, React.js, TypeScript, and Sass. I handled every aspect of the page, from design to user experience.
secondParagraph.otherOtherText: I conducted meetings with the client throughout the development process to showcase progress and ensure that we met their expectations and functional requirements.

watts.title: 25Watts
watts.subTitle: Front End Developer, Oct 2022 - Apr 2024

firstParagraph.otherText: team where I worked on the creation of websites, portfolios, ecommerce, blogs and landing pages.

list: WordPress developments with Elementor and WooCommerce.
Next.js developments with React.js, TypeScript, Node.js and Sass. Experience consuming data from a REST API to process dynamic information on the site.
Implementation of sending emails with Nodemailer. Form validations with reCaptcha v2 and v3. Map integrations with the Google Maps API.
I learned the application of agile methodologies - SRUM. Management of tools such as Jira, Figma, Docker and the workflow with Git.

secondParagraph.text: I learned the application of Agile methodologies - specifically Scrum. I am proficient in tools such as Jira, Figma, Docker, and Git workflow management.

firstParagraph.text: With more than 700 hours of practice where I learned multiple technologies, real application in projects, development of a group project with SCRUM modality to carry out an ecommerce and an individual project consisting of a SPA.

individualProyect.title: Individual Project:
individualProyect.description: I developed a SPA-type application, based on an external API of dogs to be able to visualize them in a dynamic pagination and manipulate them through filtering and ordering.

grupalProyect.title: Group Project:
grupalProyect.description: It is a web application that has been designed for the purchase and sale of computer products. It features Shopping Cart, Custom PC Builder, Wish List, filtering, and product pagination. It also has the implementation of a paid market, user registration and different roles for navigation.
